page.title: 15MARKET DAY IN ENNISKILLEN
page.content: When{CAPTAIN COLE}first established {the town}in the 17th century he had to establish a market.The day chosen was Thursday and this is still"mart"day. Although the market is outside the block the whole town reaps the benefit of the mart.Local farmers,and some from further away,converge on the town in large numbers on Thursday morning, to buy and sell cattle. This causes traffic jams at the West Bridges and Belmore Street.The{trade}of the shops increase and most have a busy day.The shops at the{DIAMOND}where the main ones are found,have a busy time. The town remains busy all day and when 5 p.m.comes the traffic jams restart as most people make their way home. Generally,apart from Saturday,Thursday is the busiest day of the week.The numbers are swollen on many Thursdays by shoppers from the REPUBLIC.
